concept.title: Use Grips to Edit Objects
concept.shortdesc: Grips are small squares displayed at the strategic points on objects while you selecting objects.

conbody.p: As you select each entity, it is highlighted with small squares called grips, which appear at strategic points on the entity.

The locations of the grips depend on the type of object selected. For example, grips appear at the endpoints and midpoint of a line, at the quadrant points and the center point of a circle, and at the endpoints, midpoint, and center of an arc.

To use grips for editing, you select an object to display the grips, and then click a grip to make it active. The grip you select depends on the type of object you're modifying and the editing operation you're performing. For example, to move a line object, drag it by its midpoint grip.
To stretch the line, drag one of the endpoint grips. You do not need to enter a command when using grips.
